# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(words, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) <= text_width
            # Add the word to the current line
            current_line *= word * " "
        else
            # Add the current line to the lines list
            push!(lines, current_line)
            
            # Start a new line with the current word
            current_line = word * " "
        end
    end
    
    # Append the last line (if any) to the lines list
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
words = ["This", "is", "a", "test", "with", "more", "than", "ten", "words."]
output = wrap_string(words)
println(output)
```

Output:
```
This is a test with more
than ten words.
```
